Good unit economics with COGS, Platform Margin, and Logistics costs defined
Large and growing market with opportunities in export, B2B, and institutional catering
Unknown traction metrics and revenue split across channels

insights: The Indian food and beverage industry is expected to grow at a CAGR of 11.19% to reach $79.65 billion by 2028.
The top 10 food companies in the world control an enormous chunk of consumer food products, with companies like PepsiCo, Nestle, and General Mills leading the way.
Food delivery services like Uber Eats, DoorDash, and Grubhub are leading the charge in sales, with Uber Eats becoming the most widely available food delivery service with the biggest userbase.

risks.message: TAM inflation risk due to high growth projections in the millet market
risks.evidence_excerpt: The global millet market size was valued at USD 11.24 billion in 2024 and is projected to grow from USD 11.76 billion in 2025 to USD 16.93 billion in 2033, exhibiting a CAGR of 4.66% during the forecast period (2025-2033).
COGS: 35, Platform Margin: 45, Logistics: 35, Naario Margin: 37, Partners: None, Big Basket: ~1-17%, Amazon: ~7-14%

kpis: Food Safety and Quality Control Metrics
snippets: Foodtech startups are revolutionizing the way we produce, process, and consume food, with the global market expected to reach $250B by 2026.
The rise of meal kits and grocery delivery has led to a 30% increase in online food sales in the past year alone.
Food waste reduction is a critical issue, with 1/3 of all food produced globally going to waste each year.
Personalized nutrition and meal planning are becoming increasingly popular, with 75% of consumers willing to pay more for tailored health and wellness solutions.
